intro: Loasa leucantha, commonly known as white loasa, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at high elevations. Loasa leucantha is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
